verses.verse: "Do you think<WH2803> this<WH384> is according to justice<WH4941>? Do you say,<WH559> 'My righteousness<WH6664> is more<WH4480> than<WH4480> God's'?
"For you say,<WH559> 'What<WH4100> advantage<WH5532> will it be to You? What<WH4100> profit<WH3276> shall I have, more<WH4480> than<WH4480> if I had sinned<WH9128>?'
"I will answer<WH7725> <WH4405> you, And your friends<WH7453> with you.
"Look<WH5027> at the heavens<WH8064> and see;<WH7200> And behold<WH7789> the clouds<WH7834> â€“ they are higher<WH1361> than<WH4480> you.
"If<WH518> you have sinned,<WH2398> what<WH4100> do you accomplish<WH6466> against Him? And if your transgressions<WH6588> are many,<WH7231> what<WH4100> do you do<WH6213> to Him?
"If<WH518> you are righteous,<WH6663> what<WH4100> do you give<WH5414> to Him? Or<WH176> what<WH4100> does He receive<WH3947> from your hand<WH3027>?
"Your wickedness<WH7562> is for a man<WH376> like<WH3644> yourself, And your righteousness<WH6666> is for a son<WH1121> of man.<WH120>
"Because<WH4480> of the multitude<WH7230> of oppressions<WH6217> they cry<WH2199> out; They cry<WH7768> for help<WH7768> because<WH4480> of the arm<WH2220> of the mighty.<WH7227>
"But no<WH3808> one says,<WH559> 'Where<WH346> is God<WH433> my Maker,<WH6213> Who gives<WH5414> songs<WH2158> in the night,<WH3915>
Who teaches<WH502> us more<WH4480> than<WH4480> the beasts<WH929> of the earth,<WH776> And makes<WH2449> us wiser<WH2449> than<WH4480> the birds<WH5775> of the heavens<WH8064>?'
"There<WH8033> they cry<WH6817> out, but He does not answer<WH6030> Because<WH4480> <WH6440> of the pride<WH1347> of evil<WH7451> men.<WH7451>
"Surely<WH389> God<WH410> will not listen<WH8085> to an empty<WH7723> [cry,] Nor<WH3808> will the Almighty<WH7706> regard<WH7789> it.
"How<WH637> much<WH637> less<WH637> when<WH3588> you say<WH559> you do not behold<WH7789> Him, The case<WH1779> is before<WH6440> Him, and you must wait<WH9123> for Him!
"And now,<WH6258> because<WH3588> He has not visited<WH6485> [in] His anger,<WH639> Nor<WH3808> has He acknowledged<WH3045> transgression<WH6588> well,<WH3966>
So Job<WH347> opens<WH6475> his mouth<WH6310> emptily;<WH1892> He multiplies<WH3527> words<WH4405> without<WH1097> knowledge.<WH1847>"
